definition: to put on or wear (glasses, hat, gloves etc)/to respect/to bear/to support
abbr. for Uighur 維吾爾|维吾尔[Wei2 wu2 er3]/surname Wei
to preserve/to maintain/to hold together/dimension/vitamin (abbr. for 維生素|维生素[wei2 sheng1 su4])
Slovakia/Slovak/abbr. for 斯洛伐克[Si1 luo4 fa2 ke4]
Lynn E. Davis (1943-), US academic and arms control expert, Under-secretary at US State Department 1993-1997

sentences.english: The shovel is the one tool that Davis and his fellow principal investigators do not use.
sentences.chinese: 鏟子是戴維斯和他的主要調查者棄之不用的工具。

sentences.english: A new Davids?That is not important.
sentences.chinese: 俱樂部是否需要一個新戴維斯？

sentences.english: Ainhoa : Will you play next round of Davis Cup ?
sentences.chinese: 你回參加下輪的戴維斯盃嗎？

sentences.english: It was from Shannon McDonald. cc: Frank Davis.
sentences.chinese: 新郵件來自夏儂麥當娜，並抄送了弗蘭克戴維斯。

sentences.english: In nineteen forty-nine Miles Davis released "Birth of the Cool."
sentences.chinese: 在一九四九年邁爾斯戴維斯發佈的“冷調的誕生。”

sentences.english: Kaylin will be attending University of California, Davis in the fall to study environmental science.
sentences.chinese: 黃愷琳將就讀於戴維斯加州大學攻讀環境科學。

sentences.english: Peter, please. " Mr. Davis" makes me sound ancient.
sentences.chinese: 請叫我彼得吧，“戴維斯先生”聽起來老氣橫秋的。

sentences.english: Rhys Davids has aptly translated the word.
sentences.chinese: 里斯戴維斯恰好翻譯了這個詞。

sentences.english: Edhead : Do you think Spain will beat USA in Davis Cup semifinal ?
sentences.chinese: 你覺得西班牙會在戴維斯盃四強擊敗美國嗎？

sentences.english: Davis, says Hollywood offen influences costume choices as well.
sentences.chinese: 戴維斯說，好萊塢通常也會影響戲裝的選擇。

sentences.english: Dr. Matthew Davis, who was not involved in the study, agrees.
sentences.chinese: 沒有參加該調查的馬修戴維斯博士也認同魯蒙的說法。

sentences.english: Davies is busy adapting Brinkworth's latest novel for television.
sentences.chinese: 戴維斯忙於爲電視劇改編那個著名作家的最新小說。

sentences.english: Davies conceded more free-kicks than any other player in the top flight last season.
sentences.chinese: 戴維斯在上賽季英超中是犯規次數最多的球員。

sentences.english: Nosair and Davis, who wascharged with shooting six cops, were both acquitted.
sentences.chinese: 諾塞爾和戴維斯均無罪開釋。

sentences.english: ‘China gives us new methodologies and new processes,’ Davis said.
sentences.chinese: “中國爲我們提供了新方法和新工藝，”戴維斯說。

definition: to return to one's unit/to go back to one's station in life
to replace (a damaged component with a new one, an injured player with a substitute player, full-time workers with casual workers etc)/a substitute/a replacement
(in classical literature) young military officer of high rank for his age/(during the Cultural Revolution) young militant in the Red Guard/(in modern usage) rising star (in sport, politics etc)
to compete/to take part (in a sports event)
governor (of a province or colony)/US state governor/premier (Australian states)
